pageContext.description: A fragment of copper-alloy Bronze Age axe or adze, 26.3mm in length and 38.7mm wide, comprising the blade tip. The edge of the blade is curved without flared tips and has a profile suggesting that this is possibly of the Middle Bronze Age palstave type. The patina is light green to brownish grey. The break reveals a casting void which approaches the surface on one side and may demonstrate a weakness which led to original break.
pageContext.notes: Found in the same area as SUR-E6EBD6, but no clear association is demonstrable due to a lack of accurate findspot being provided by the finder.
